source.941c4f58:
import matplotlib.patches as mpatches
y1 = df['Beer_PerCapita']
y2 = df['Spirit_PerCapita']
y3 = df['Wine_PerCapita']
x = df['HappinessScore']
bar_width = 0.10
plt.bar(x,y1,width=bar_width,color='green',zorder=2)
plt.bar(x+bar_width,y2,width=bar_width,color='orange',zorder=2)
plt.bar(x+bar_width,y3,width=bar_width,color='blue',zorder=2)
plt.xlabel("Happines Score")
plt.ylabel('Consumption per capita')
green_patch = mpatches.Patch(color='green',label='Beer')
orange_patch = mpatches.Patch(color='orange',label='Spirit')
blue_patch = mpatches.Patch(color='blue',label='Wine')
plt.legend(handles=[green_patch,orange_patch,blue_patch])
source.f6aef94e:
#avg alochol consumption
df['avg_alochol per capita'] = (df['Beer_PerCapita'] + df['Wine_PerCapita'] + df['Spirit_PerCapita'])/3
source.1397533e:
plt.bar(df['avg_alochol per capita'],df['GDP_PerCapita'])
plt.xlabel('Alochol Consumption per capita')
plt.ylabel('GDP per capita')

source.f66f8293:
from sklearn import preprocessing
label_encoder = preprocessing.LabelEncoder()
x_train['Region'] = label_encoder.fit_transform(x_train['Region'])
x_test['Region'] = label_encoder.fit_transform(x_test['Region'])
source.533f2161:
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
linear = LinearRegression()
linear.fit(x_train,y_train)
linear.score(x_test,y_test)
source.2edd4b30:
y_test_pred = linear.predict(x_test)
plt.plot(y_test,y_test_pred)
plt.xlabel('Actual Value')
plt.ylabel('predicted value')
source.805ac0da:
from sklearn.ensemble import GradientBoostingRegressor
boost = GradientBoostingRegressor()
boost.fit(x_train,y_train)
boost.score(x_test,y_test)
source.878b0957:
y_test_pred = boost.predict(x_test)
plt.plot(y_test,y_test_pred,color='red')
plt.xlabel('Actual Value')
plt.ylabel('predicted value')
source.3e19949e: > Wine dominates at the highest happiness score side , more happier people are consuming more wine and Beer is consumed by all the groups of people at every happiness level and spirit is mostly consumed by people at lower and mower middile happiness score

source.f01a69cb: it's only 46 percent co related , not that much
source.c575b6ca:
> this is what we never expected , Per capita gross domestic product (GDP) is a metric that breaks down a country's economic output per person and is calculated by dividing the GDP of a country by its population.
> so basically sub sahara has the highest per capita according to this dataset and not just high , a lot high
source.7264b7de: > Australia and NewZeland are the place of happiest people while sub saharan africa are the least happiest people on planet
source.dfa6fcd7: > Wester Europe has the highest HDI , N American and Australia NZ have only two countries so we would give more importance to Western Europe
source.c5d5b1a5: > This simply suggests that more the average alochol consumption in any country more is the per capita GDP
source.704ed1e1: > Alcohol Consumption increases Happiness for sure and in case of Western Europe it's heavily influencing the happiness of people and the most dominating drink is Wine , even though each drink increases happiness score but wine dominates it
source.f957cbeb: # Let us Explore more about the most happiest region in the WORLD
source.c5ff7c9c:
> Beer : Wester Europe consumes the highest amount of it and they also have the highest happiness score ,
> Spirit : Central and Eastern Europe is the highest consumer of it and it also explains the popularity of Vodka, 
> Wine : Again Western Europe is the highest consumer of Wine , well this also gives a rough idea that consumption of alochol do affect happiness of people in a positive way
